comment.author: 28367991@N08
comment._content: I can't see any contact wire, is that a diesel tram?

comment.author: 13918332@N00
comment._content: I think they are telegraph wires.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: It is a cable tram which ran on this route (King Street wharf to Ocean Street Edgecliff) between 1894 and 1905 before electrification. More info: www.powerhousemuseum.com/collection/database/?irn=207898&... See also www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3022880907/ St Mary;s Cathedral tower was completed in 1900, so this photo must be 1900-05.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The statue of Prince Albert has moved to about where this photo was taken, opposite and looking at his wife Queen Victoria. An old photo: www.medfac.usyd.edu.au/museum/image.php?FMMUS=FMMUS3478 More info: www.publicartaroundtheworld.com/Prince_Albert_Statue.html
